brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this randomized clinical trial was to compare caries prevention of a
      conventional resin-based sealant and a glass-ionomer sealant placed on occlusal pits and
      fissures over a one year period in a high caries children group.  Additionally the
      concentration of Fluoride in saliva was evaluated.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Caries Prevention Effect of Fissure Sealants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  1.Age range of 6 to 10 years 2.Having caries free, fully erupted first permanent
             molars 3.Deep and/or intermediate pits or fissures 4.dft ≥ 2

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  1.Having any systemic disease 2.Topical fluoride was applied last six months 3.dft =
             0

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial of Caries Prevention Effect of a Glass Ionomer Sealant Versus a Resin Sealant

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Fluoride concentration of saliva

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Prevention
